intro: Hydrobryum subcylindricum, commonly known as the slender-stemmed marsh moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, creeping growth habit and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as wetlands and forest floors. The plant has elongated, cylindrical stems that are often covered in small, overlapping leaves. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, develop on the upper surface of the leaves, producing spores for propagation. Hydrobryum subcylindricum plays a role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its native habitats.
